name: Congenital Dyserythropoietic Anemia Type IV (CDA-IV)
chief_complaint: I feel extremely tired all the time, and my skin has been turning yellow.
treatment: regular packed red blood cell transfusions
consideration for hematopoietic stem cell transplantation in eligible patients
prognosis: variable; depends on transfusion dependence and complications (e.g., iron overload). Some patients develop progressive liver fibrosis.
description: CDA-IV is an ultra-rare inherited disorder of erythropoiesis characterized by ineffective red blood cell production and hemolysis. It results from mutations in the KLF1 gene, leading to abnormal erythroblast maturation. The condition presents in childhood or early adulthood with transfusion-dependent anemia and secondary hemochromatosis.
